Articles.Content:
Is anyone else having some problems with 0.90 and strut connectors

Particularly after carefully placing many struts on a rocket, then saving and re loading to find that many of the other end points may not be set.

Same can often happen when fixing above then going to launch. just seconds ago it was all good in the VAB, but when it loads on the launch pad, it has the same problem, many of the other end points are missing.

with that other end point missing there is no strut created.

mods installed are;

Kerbal Alarm Clock

KAS

Kerbal Konstruct

MechJeb 2

Module Manager

Large Structural Components (not used in this example)

Docking Port Alignment Indicator

Docking Cam

LazTec SpaceX 3 packs HD (Not used in this example)

Docking Alignment Indicator.

Bryce.

Edited December 22, 2014 by Claw

Have you been able to replicate the effect without any of the mods installed? It doesn't seem like any of them should affect it, but there's always the possibility of strange bugs.

I haven't encountered this yet myself, except for with subassemblies - but that's not a new problem.

Sounds like modded support might be a better option.

Cheers,

~Claw

It turns out to be that as I rotated a fairing part in VAB (Hitchhiker Storage Container). the connections broke in a way, I replaced the strut and visualy it was there, but on reload, there must have been another end point where the second end point was trying to connect to.

retried it by rotating a fresh part first then placed the struts.

got it to work properly now.

Bryce.

Edited December 22, 2014 by Bryce Ring
